data.title: Sync selected process from debug widget to callstack
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15305

- Start debugging two processes
- Click between one and the other in the callstack, and notice that the debug widget dropdown changes as you'd expect. 
- Change the selected process in the debug widget dropdown, and notice that the selection in the callstack doesn't change

I think everything should be in sync, especially since the editor changes, and then doesn't match the selected stack frame. When one process isn't at a breakpoint, it could select the process' root node.

data.title: Default settings search: Let ArrowUp/-Down navigate the result list

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #16530

Similar to Enter navigating to the next setting. ArrowUp/-Down should navigate to the previous/next setting.

It would be great if that search & results UI would behave *a little bit* more like a combo box, IntelliSense or the command palette. Enter could trigger the Edit action.

Related: #16718

data.title: ./scripts/code.sh - Provided debugging port 5870 is not free, using 0 instead
data.body:
Just synced with master and seeing the following output when running `./scripts/code.sh`:


```bash
matb@~/projects/vscode$./scripts/code.sh 
[76102:1206/132105:INFO:CONSOLE(143)] "%c[Extension Host] %cCould not find a free port for debugging", source: file:////Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/extensionHost.js (143)
[76102:1206/132105:INFO:CONSOLE(147)] "%c[Extension Host] %cProvided debugging port 5870 is not free, using 0 instead.", source: file:////Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/extensionHost.js (147)
[76102:1206/132105:INFO:CONSOLE(153)] "%c[Extension Host] %cdebugger listening on port 0", source: file:////Users/matb/projects/vscode/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/extensionHost.js (153)
```

Before we fell back to `5872`

data.title: Get coverage info from mocha tests
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Win10 x64 Pro

Hello. I develop an VSCode extension with integrated mocha tests as described here: https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/extensions/testing-extensions

I want to calculate code coverage information from my tests.

I tried to use istanbul and nyc (add them before `node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/test`), tried to set the `reporter` property at testrunner constructor - no luck. 

Is there any way to get coverage information from such test run?

data.title: OnEnterRule: outdent current line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
`OnEnterRule` should allow for the *current* line to be outdented, not just subsequent lines.

Either:
1. extend `IndentAction` with `OutdentCurrent`;
2. extend `IndentationRule` with `decreaseCurrentIndentPattern`; or
3. extend `IndentAction` with `command`, which accepts a command name that is to be registered to a function that accepts the current editor, position where enter was pressed, and possibly a `TextEdit`.

### Example
Given the following text, with the cursor position indicated by `|`:
```
Proof.
    trivial.
    Qed.|
```
After enter:
```
Proof.
    trivial.
Qed.
|
```

data.title: View Picker should include grouping for items during search
data.body:
Testing #16147

Steps to reproduce:
1. Ctrl+P to open Quick Open

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/20942608/ed519982-bbb0-11e6-8a63-ac5cda36e399.png)

Ideally, we would denote the grouping on each entry, as we do before one initiates the search

data.title: install extensions UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

I've published an update to my extension an hour or two ago (plenty of time for the caches to be updated, I assume). When listing installed extensions, vscode correctly shows that an update is available, *but*:

1. only the current version number is shown - both the current and most recent version should be given
2. the details, changelog, etc. are for the currently installed version. What's the point of a description (and especially!) a changelog if it doesn't tell you about the update?

data.title: "Copy to Settings" overwrites existing value
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (c425cd159bd389844e9400be801675f54f2443c7, 2016-12-06T16:53:46.634Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Testing #16530

1. Change e.g. fontFamily
2. Click edit icon for fontFamily in default editor
3. Choose "Copy to Settings"
4. Previous value is overwritten with the default

The existing value should not be overwritten. It might improve usability to rename the menu item to "Edit in User Settings" (and "Edit in Workspace Settings"), after all the user already is "in settings" when being shown that menu item.

(Also note that currently 'settings' starts with lowercase 's', when it should start with uppercase 'S' as we're using title casing.)

data.title: The Debug button and dropdown is not reachable via keyboard
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 insiders dated 12/6
- OS Version: All

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Tab through and try to reach the debug button

**Expected**: After the "Extensions" icon in the activity bar the next tab stop should be the debug button. The next one after that should go to the drop down and user should be able to interact with the drop down.
**Actual**: After the "Extensions" icon in the activity bar, the next tab stop goes to an unknown land, the next one goes to the gear icon.

data.title: Can't escape ':' in a snippet variable default value
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15875

Have a snippet like

```
"test": {
  "prefix": "test",
  "body": "foo ${TM_SELECTED_TEXT:foo\\:bar} ${TM_SELECTED_TEXT:foo:bar}"
}
```

With no selected text, the result is `foo foo\bar foobar`. I think one of these should insert a `:`, either the escaped one, or colons after the first colon should appear.

data.title: No tooltip on selected config in the launch widget
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8 insiders dated 12/6
- OS Version: All

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a launch config
2. Hover on the launch config name in the launch widget

**Expected**: Tooltip for the name of the selected config. Is useful when the name is too long.
**Actual**: No tooltip

3. Hover on the arrow for the drop down

**Expected**: Nothing
**Actual**: Tooltip for the name of the selected config

data.title: typescript.check.tscVersion should not be in most commonly used, a most useful list would be better
data.body:
#16530

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (c425cd159bd389844e9400be801675f54f2443c7, 2016-12-06T17:07:24.668Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.8.0-28-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0|
|theme-glacier|Tyriar|0.0.10|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.7.1|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.0|
|Theme-Wombat|gerane|0.0.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.3|
|typescript-javascript-grammar|ms-vscode|0.0.10|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|
|dark-plus-material|vangware|0.1.4|

---

While this is called most commonly used and that may be correct, I think a curated list of "most useful" would actually be more beneficial. `typescript.check.tscVersion` is set so much because it's set via a message box. Just because it's forced upon people does not mean it should be one of the small selection of settings presented in the precious space above the fold.
